alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. John The Baptist (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 5:23PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern St. John The Baptist, southeastern Livingston and southern Tangipahoa Parishes through 615 PM CDT... At 523 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Robert, or near Hammond, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Ponchatoula, Albany, Springfield, Natalbany, Robert, Killian and W Lk Pontchartrain Buoy. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 32 and 52. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 14 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. John The Baptist
